page.title: 09Chailey Heritage School
page.content: Chailey Heritage School is world famous. In 1903 Dame Grace Kimmins and her friend, Alice Rennie gave a home to seven physically handicapped boys from the East End of London.Today there are about 160 physically handicapped residential and day pupils on three sites on Chailey Common. At the new heritage there are hospital wards, day rooms for lessons, therapy units, rehabilitation engineering, operating and X ray, an indoor swimming pool and all weather riding surfce and two bungalows for visiting parents and older children. Mr Hugh Parrot is the Headteacher and Mr Alastair Bruce is the Deputy Head at the time of writing in 1985. Mr Bruce has developed a large computer resouces center for the teachers at the Heritage School
